InstallingCanvas.name: Installing Canvas
InstallingCanvas.content:
# Installing Canvas

Let's start off by introducing what canvas is. In HTML, the `<canvas>` element can be used to draw images via scripting with JavaScript. The canvas that we're talking about is a Cairo backed canvas implementation for NodeJS. An example of something that can be done with canvas is this.

![Canvas Command](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kyranet/canvasConstructor/master/guides/assets/canvas-example.png)

Here, the bot is using canvas to edit a template and insert your avatar, and a random users avatar onto the template. So that's just an example of what Canvas can do, let's get down to installing it.

## Installation Steps

Based on what OS you're on, there are different steps to install the required prerequisites.

OS | Command
----- | -----
OS X | `brew install pkg-config cairo pango libpng jpeg giflib`
Ubuntu | `sudo apt install libcairo2-dev libjpeg-dev libpango1.0-dev libgif-dev build-essential g++`
Fedora | `sudo yum install cairo cairo-devel cairomm-devel libjpeg-turbo-devel pango pango-devel pangomm pangomm-devel giflib-devel`
Solaris | `pkgin install cairo pango pkg-config xproto renderproto kbproto xextproto`
Windows | Instructions below

## Installing on Windows

### Step 1

First, you need to run `npm install --global --production windows-build-tools` from a PowerShell or command prompt run as an administrator. This will take a little while, so be prepared to do other stuff while it installs.

**>Notes:**

- While the npm page tells you to install GTK and libjpeg-turbo, those aren't needed! Both canvas and canvas-constructor function perfectly fine without them, so they're really just taking up space that could be used for something else.

### Step 2

The next and final step is simple.

You can either do...

```bash
npm i canvas
```

...to install the stable version, or you could do...

```bash
npm i Automattic/node-canvas#92b192447e9b9ae98da0f801e4e34afdd1dc1ef8
```

...to install a working commit of version 2.0.

Next, to install canvas-constructor, you just need to do

```bash
npm i canvas-constructor
```

If you followed the guide completely, your console should look something like this, and you're good to go!

![Install Screenshot](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kyranet/canvasConstructor/master/guides/assets/installation-screenshot.png)

GettingStarted.name: Getting Started
GettingStarted.content:
# Getting Started

Please check {@tutorial InstallingCanvas} for the installation. You **must** have Canvas installed and working before using this package.

---

How to use it:

```js
const { Canvas } = require('canvas-constructor');

new Canvas(300, 300)
    .setColor('#AEFD54')
    .addRect(5, 5, 290, 290)
    .setColor('#FFAE23')
    .setTextFont('28px Impact')
    .addText('Hello World!', 130, 150)
    .toBuffer();
```

- That will create a canvas with size of 300 pixels width, 300 pixels height.
- Set the colour to #AEFD54
- Draw a rectangle with the previous colour, covering all the pixels from (5, 5) to (290 + 5, 290 + 5)
- Set the colour to #FFAE23
- Set the font size to 28 pixels with font Impact.
- Write the text 'Hello World!' in the position (130, 150)
- Return a buffer.

![Hello World!](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kyranet/canvasConstructor/master/guides/assets/getting-started-example-01.png)

Now, let's suppose we want to add images. I'd recommend [fs-nextra](https://github.com/bdistin/fs-nextra), by BDISTIN, it requires Node.js 8.5.0 to work (it promisifies the async fs methods with `Util.promisify()`), it's a dependency-free and lightweight package that provides support for **atomic operations**.

```js
const { Canvas } = require('canvas-constructor');
const fsn = require('fs-nextra');

async function createCanvas() {
    const image = await fsn.readFile('./images/kitten.png');

    return new Canvas(300, 400)
        .addImage(image, 0, 0, 300, 400)
        .setColor('#FFAE23')
        .setTextFont('28px Impact')
        .setTextAlign('center')
        .addText('Kitten!', 150, 370)
        .toBufferAsync();
}
```

- That will create a canvas with size of 300 pixels width, 400 pixels height.
- Draw an image, given a Buffer (the image from the images folder).
- Set the colour to #FFAE23
- Set the font size to 28 pixels with font Impact.
- Set the text alignment to center.
- Write the text 'Kitten!' in the position (150, 370)
- Return a buffer.

![Kitten!](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kyranet/canvasConstructor/master/guides/assets/getting-started-example-02.png)

And now, you have created an image with a kitten in the background and some centered text in the bottom of it.

If you experience issues with **Canvas** or want to install it, please refer to the [canvas](https://www.npmjs.com/package/canvas) repository, if you feel you found an issue in this package, feel free to file an issue [here](https://github.com/kyranet/canvasConstructor/issues), or make a [Pull Request](https://help.github.com/articles/about-pull-requests/) if you have the fix.

ProfileCard.name: Profile Card

params.name: width
params.description: The canvas' width in pixels.

params.name: height
params.description: The canvas' height in pixels.

params.name: type
params.description: The canvas type.

props.name: width
props.description: The image width of this canvas

props.name: height
props.description: The image height of this canvas

props.name: lineDash
props.description: A list of numbers that specifies distances to alternately draw a line and a gap (in coordinate space units).If the number, when setting the elements, was odd, the elements of the array get copied and concatenated.

methods.name: changeCanvasSize
methods.description: Change the current canvas' size.

params.name: width
params.description: The new width for the canvas.

params.name: height
params.description: The new heigth for the canvas.

methods.name: changeCanvasWidth
methods.description: Change the current canvas' width.

params.name: width
params.description: The new width for the canvas.

methods.name: changeCanvasHeigth
methods.description: Change the current canvas' height.

params.name: height
params.description: The new height for the canvas.

methods.name: save
methods.description: Save the entire state of the canvas by pushing the current state onto a stack.

methods.name: restore
methods.description: Restores the most recently saved canvas by popping the top entry in the drawing state stack. If there is no saved state, this method does nothing.

methods.name: rotate
methods.description: Adds a rotation to the transformation matrix. The angle argument represents a clockwise rotation angle and is expressed in radians.

params.name: angle
params.description: The angle to rotate clockwise in radians.

methods.name: scale
methods.description: Adds a scaling transformation to the canvas units by X horizontally and by y vertically.

params.name: dx
params.description: Scaling factor in the horizontal direction.

params.name: dy
params.description: Scaling factor in the vertical direction.

methods.name: translate
methods.description: Adds a translation transformation by moving the canvas and its origin X horizontally and y vertically on the grid.

params.name: dx
params.description: Distance to move in the horizontal direction.

params.name: dy
params.description: Distance to move in the vertical direction.

methods.name: clip
methods.description: Turns the path currently being built into the current clipping path.

params.name: path
params.description: A Path2D path to fill.

params.name: fillRule
params.description: The algorithm by which to determine if a point is inside a path oroutside a path.

methods.name: setTransform
methods.description: Resets (overrides) the current transformation to the identity matrix and then invokes a transformation describedby the arguments of this method.

params.name: a
params.description: Horizontal scaling.

params.name: b
params.description: Horizontal skewing.

params.name: c
params.description: Vertical skewing.

params.name: d
params.description: Vertical scaling.

params.name: e
params.description: Horizontal moving.

params.name: f
params.description: Vertical moving.

methods.name: resetTransformation
methods.description: Reset the transformation.

methods.name: getImageData
methods.description: Returns an ImageData object representing the underlying pixel data for the area of the canvas denoted by the rectangle which starts at (sx, sy)and has an sw width and sh height. This method is not affected by the canvas transformation matrix.

params.name: dx
params.description: The X coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle from which the ImageData will be extracted.

params.name: dy
params.description: The Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle from which the ImageData will be extracted.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the rectangle from which the ImageData will be extracted.

params.name: height
params.description: The height of the rectangle from which the ImageData will be extracted.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback, if not specified, this method won't be chainable as it will return anumber. If you use an arrow function, you might want to use the second argument which is the instance of theclass. Otherwise, the keyword this is binded to the class instance itself, so you can use it safely.

methods.name: putImageData
methods.description: The CanvasRenderingContext2D.putImageData() method of the Canvas 2D API paints data from the given ImageData object onto the bitmap.If a dirty rectangle is provided, only the pixels from that rectangle are painted.This method is not affected by the canvas transformation matrix.

params.name: imagedata
params.description: An ImageData object containing the array of pixel values.

params.name: dx
params.description: Horizontal position (x-coordinate) at which to place the image data in the destination canvas.

params.name: dy
params.description: Vertical position (y-coordinate) at which to place the image data in the destination canvas.

params.name: dirtyX
params.description: Horizontal position (x-coordinate). The X coordinate of the top left hand corner of your Image data. Defaults to 0.

params.name: dirtyY
params.description: Vertical position (y-coordinate). The Y coordinate of the top left hand corner of your Image data. Defaults to 0.

params.name: dirtyWidth
params.description: Width of the rectangle to be painted. Defaults to the width of the image data.

params.name: dirtyHeight
params.description: Height of the rectangle to be painted. Defaults to the height of the image data.

methods.name: fill
methods.description: Fills the current or given path with the current fill style using the non-zero or even-odd winding rule.

params.name: path
params.description: A Path2D path to fill.

params.name: fillRule
params.description: The algorithm by which to determine if a point is inside a path oroutside a path.

methods.name: addText
methods.description: Add a text.

params.name: text
params.description: The text to write.

params.name: dx
params.description: The position x to start drawing the element.

params.name: dy
params.description: The position y to start drawing the element.

params.name: maxWidth
params.description: The maximum width to draw. If specified, and the string is computed to be wider thanthis width, the font is adjusted to use a more horizontally condensed font.

methods.name: addResponsiveText
methods.description: Add responsive text

params.name: text
params.description: The text to write.

params.name: dx
params.description: The position x to start drawing the element.

params.name: dy
params.description: The position y to start drawing the element.

params.name: maxWidth
params.description: The max length in pixels for the text.

methods.name: addMultilineText
methods.description: Add responsive text
examples: new Canvas(400, 300)    .setTextFont('25px Tahoma')    .addMultilineText('This is a really long text!', 139, 360, 156, 28)    .toBuffer();

params.name: text
params.description: The text to write.

params.name: dx
params.description: The position x to start drawing the element.

params.name: dy
params.description: The position y to start drawing the element.

params.name: maxWidth
params.description: The max length in pixels for the text.

params.name: lineHeight
params.description: The line's height.

methods.name: stroke
methods.description: Strokes the current or given path with the current stroke style using the non-zero winding rule.

params.name: path
params.description: A Path2D path to stroke.

methods.name: addStrokeRect
methods.description: Paints a rectangle which has a starting point at (X, Y) and has a w width and an h height onto the canvas, usingthe current stroke style.

params.name: dx
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate for the rectangle starting point.

params.name: dy
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate for the rectangle starting point.

params.name: width
params.description: The rectangle's width.

params.name: height
params.description: The rectangle's height.

methods.name: addStrokeText
methods.description: Add stroked text.

params.name: text
params.description: The text to write.

params.name: dx
params.description: The position x to start drawing the element.

params.name: dy
params.description: The position y to start drawing the element.

methods.name: measureText
methods.description: Measure a text's width given a string.If a callback is not passed, this method will not be chainable, and it will return an integer instead.
examples: new Canvas(500, 400)    .setTextFont('40px Tahoma')    .measureText('Hello World!', function(size) {        const newSize = size.width < 500 ? 40 : (500 / size.width) * 40;        this.setTextFont(`${newSize}px Tahoma`);    })    .addText('Hello World!', 30, 50)    .toBuffer(); // Returns a Buffer

new Canvas(500, 400)    .setTextFont('40px Tahoma')    .measureText('Hello World!', (size, inst) => {        const newSize = size.width < 500 ? 40 : (500 / size.width) * 40;        inst.setTextFont(`${newSize}px`);    })    .addText('Hello World!', 30, 50)    .toBuffer(); // Returns a Buffer

const size = new Canvas(500, 400)    .setTextFont('40px Tahoma')    .measureText('Hello World!'); // Returns a numberconst newSize = size.width < 500 ? 40 : (500 / size.width) * 40;new Canvas(500, 400)    .setTextFont(`${newSize}px Tahoma`)    .addText('Hello World!', 30, 50)    .toBuffer(); // Returns a Buffer

params.name: text
params.description: The text to measure.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback, if not specified, this method won't be chainable as it will return anumber. If you use an arrow function, you might want to use the second argument which is the instance of theclass. Otherwise, the keyword this is binded to the class instance itself, so you can use it safely.

methods.name: setTextSize
methods.description: Set the new font size, unlike setTextFont, this only requires the number.

params.name: size
params.description: The new size to set

methods.name: setStroke
methods.description: Specifies the color or style to use for the lines around shapes. The default is #000000 (black).

params.name: color
params.description: A canvas' color resolvable.

methods.name: setLineWidth
methods.description: Sets the thickness of lines in space units.

params.name: width
params.description: A number specifying the line width in space units.

methods.name: setLineDashOffset
methods.description: Sets the line dash pattern offset or "phase" to achieve a "marching ants" effect

params.name: value
params.description: A float specifying the amount of the offset. Initially 0.0.

methods.name: setLineJoin
methods.description: Determines how two connecting segments (of lines, arcs or curves) with non-zero lengths in a shape are joinedtogether (degenerate segments with zero lengths, whose specified endpoints and control points are exactly at thesame position, are skipped).

params.name: value
params.description: The line join type.

methods.name: setLineCap
methods.description: Determines how the end points of every line are drawn. There are three possible values for this property andthose are: butt, round and square. By default this property is set to butt.

params.name: value
params.description: The line join type.

methods.name: setLineDash
methods.description: Sets the line dash pattern used when stroking lines, using an array of values which specify alternating lengthsof lines and gaps which describe the pattern.

params.name: segments
params.description: An Array of numbers which specify distances to alternately draw a line and a gap (incoordinate space units). If the number of elements in the array is odd, the elements of the array get copied andconcatenated. For example, [5, 15, 25] will become [5, 15, 25, 5, 15, 25]. If the array is empty, the line dashlist is cleared and line strokes return to being solid.

methods.name: addImage
methods.description: Add an image.

params.name: imageOrBuffer
params.description: The image's buffer.

params.name: dx
params.description: The X coordinate in the destination canvas at which to place the top-left corner of the source image.

params.name: dy
params.description: The Y coordinate in the destination canvas at which to place the top-left corner of the source image.

params.name: dWidth
params.description: The width to draw the image in the destination canvas. This allows scaling of the drawn image. If not specified, the image is not scaled in width when drawn.

params.name: dHeight
params.description: The height to draw the image in the destination canvas. This allows scaling of the drawn image. If not specified, the image is not scaled in height when drawn.

params.name: sx
params.description: The X coordinate of the top left corner of the sub-rectangle of the source image to draw into the destination context.

params.name: sy
params.description: The Y coordinate of the top left corner of the sub-rectangle of the source image to draw into the destination context.

params.name: sWidth
params.description: The width of the sub-rectangle of the source image to draw into the destination context. If not specified, the entire rectangle from the coordinates specified by sx and sy to the bottom-right corner of the image is used.

params.name: sHeight
params.description: The height of the sub-rectangle of the source image to draw into the destination context.

params.name: options
params.description: Options.

params.name: options.radius
params.description: The radius for the new image.

params.name: options.type
params.description: The type for the new image.

params.name: options.restore
params.description: Whether this method should restore the drawing state. Use this when you use options.type

methods.name: addRoundImage
methods.description: Add a round image.

params.name: imageOrBuffer
params.description: The image's buffer.

params.name: dx
params.description: The X coordinate in the destination canvas at which to place the top-left corner of the source image.

params.name: dy
params.description: The Y coordinate in the destination canvas at which to place the top-left corner of the source image.

params.name: dWidth
params.description: The width to draw the image in the destination canvas. This allows scaling of the drawn image. If not specified, the image is not scaled in width when drawn.

params.name: dHeight
params.description: The height to draw the image in the destination canvas. This allows scaling of the drawn image. If not specified, the image is not scaled in height when drawn.

params.name: radius
params.description: The radius for the circle

params.name: restore
params.description: Whether this method should restore the drawing state.

methods.name: addCircularImage
methods.description: Add a circular image, as opposed to addRoundImage, this method does not set dx and dy in the top left corner of the image. Instead, they're positioned in the center, works similarly to `addCircle`.

params.name: imageOrBuffer
params.description: The image's buffer.

params.name: dx
params.description: The X coordinate in the destination canvas at which to place the center of the image.

params.name: dy
params.description: The Y coordinate in the destination canvas at which to place the center of the image.

params.name: radius
params.description: The radius for the circle, it sets the image's width and heigth as the diameter (radius * 2).

params.name: restore
params.description: Whether this method should restore the drawing state.

methods.name: addBeveledImage
methods.description: Add a beveled image.

params.name: imageOrBuffer
params.description: The image's buffer.

params.name: dx
params.description: The position x to start drawing the element.

params.name: dy
params.description: The position y to start drawing the element.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the element.

params.name: height
params.description: The heigth of the element.

params.name: radius
params.description: The radius for the new image.

params.name: restore
params.description: Whether this method should restore the drawing state.

methods.name: addCircle
methods.description: Add a circle or semi circle.

params.name: dx
params.description: The position x in the center of the circle.

params.name: dy
params.description: The position y in the center of the ircle.

params.name: radius
params.description: The radius for the clip.

methods.name: addRect
methods.description: Add a rectangle.

params.name: dx
params.description: The position x to start drawing the element.

params.name: dy
params.description: The position y to start drawing the element.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the element.

params.name: height
params.description: The heigth of the element.

methods.name: addBeveledRect
methods.description: Add a beveled rectangle.

params.name: dx
params.description: The position x to start drawing the element.

params.name: dy
params.description: The position y to start drawing the element.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the element.

params.name: height
params.description: The heigth of the element.

params.name: radius
params.description: The radius for the bevels.

methods.name: createRoundPath
methods.description: Create a round path.

params.name: dx
params.description: The position x in the center of the clip's circle.

params.name: dy
params.description: The position y in the center of the clip's circle.

params.name: radius
params.description: The radius for the clip.

params.name: start
params.description: The degree in radians to start drawing the circle.

params.name: angle
params.description: The degree in radians to finish drawing the circle, defaults to a full circle.

methods.name: createRoundClip
methods.description: Create a round clip.

params.name: dx
params.description: The position x in the center of the clip's circle.

params.name: dy
params.description: The position y in the center of the clip's circle.

params.name: radius
params.description: The radius for the clip.

params.name: start
params.description: The degree in radians to start drawing the circle.

params.name: angle
params.description: The degree in radians to finish drawing the circle, defaults to a full circle.

methods.name: createRectPath
methods.description: Create a rectangle path.

params.name: dx
params.description: The position x in the left corner.

params.name: dy
params.description: The position y in the upper corner.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the rectangle.

params.name: height
params.description: The height of the rectangle.

methods.name: createRectClip
methods.description: Create a rectangle clip.

params.name: dx
params.description: The position x in the left corner.

params.name: dy
params.description: The position y in the upper corner.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the rectangle.

params.name: height
params.description: The height of the rectangle.

methods.name: createBeveledPath
methods.description: Create a beveled path.

params.name: dx
params.description: The position x to start drawing clip.

params.name: dy
params.description: The position y to start drawing clip.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of clip.

params.name: height
params.description: The heigth of clip.

params.name: radius
params.description: The radius for clip's rounded borders.

methods.name: createBeveledClip
methods.description: Create a beveled clip.

params.name: dx
params.description: The position x to start drawing clip.

params.name: dy
params.description: The position y to start drawing clip.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of clip.

params.name: height
params.description: The heigth of clip.

params.name: radius
params.description: The radius for clip's rounded borders.

methods.name: setColor
methods.description: Set a color for the canvas' context.

params.name: color
params.description: A canvas' color resolvable.

methods.name: setTextFont
methods.description: Change the font.

params.name: font
params.description: The font's name to set.

methods.name: setTextAlign
methods.description: Change the font alignment.

params.name: align
params.description: The font's alignment to set.

methods.name: setTextBaseline
methods.description: Change the font's baseline.

params.name: baseline
params.description: The font's baseline to set.

methods.name: beginPath
methods.description: Starts a new path by emptying the list of sub-paths.

methods.name: closePath
methods.description: Causes the point of the pen to move back to the start of the current sub-path.If the shape has already been closed or has only one point, this function does nothing.

methods.name: createPattern
methods.description: Creates a pattern using the specified image. It repeats the source in the directions specified by the repetitionargument.

params.name: imageOrBuffer
params.description: A Canvas Image to be used as the image to repeat.

params.name: repetition
params.description: The repeat mode.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to take the createPattern

methods.name: printPattern
methods.description: Creates a pattern using the specified image. It repeats the source in the directions specified by the repetitionargument, and prints it.

params.name: imageOrBuffer
params.description: A Canvas Image to be used as the image to repeat.

params.name: repetition
params.description: The repeat mode.

methods.name: createLinearGradient
methods.description: Creates a gradient along the line given by the coordinates represented by the parameters.The coordinates are global, the second point does not rely on the position of the first and vice versa.

params.name: x0
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate of the start point.

params.name: y0
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate of the start point.

params.name: x1
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate of the end point.

params.name: y1
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate of the end point.

params.name: steps
params.description: The steps.

methods.name: printLinearGradient
methods.description: Creates a gradient along the line given by the coordinates represented by the parameters.The coordinates are global, the second point does not rely on the position of the first and vice versa. Thismethod is chainable and calls setColor after creating the gradient.
examples: new Canvas(200, 200)    .printLinearGradient(0, 0, 200, 50, [        { position: 0, color: 'white' },        { position: 0.25, color: 'red' },        { position: 0.5, color: 'blue' }    ])    .addRect(10, 10, 200, 100)

params.name: x0
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate of the start point.

params.name: y0
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate of the start point.

params.name: x1
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate of the end point.

params.name: y1
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate of the end point.

params.name: steps
params.description: The steps.

methods.name: createRadialGradient
methods.description: Creates a radial gradient given by the coordinates of the two circles represented by the parameters.

params.name: x0
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate of the start circle.

params.name: y0
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate of the start circle.

params.name: r0
params.description: The radius of the start circle.

params.name: x1
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate of the end circle.

params.name: y1
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate of the end circle.

params.name: r1
params.description: The radius of the end circle.

params.name: steps
params.description: The steps.

methods.name: printRadialGradient
methods.description: Creates a radial gradient given by the coordinates of the two circles represented by the parameters. Thismethod is chainable and calls setColor after creating the gradient.

params.name: x0
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate of the start circle.

params.name: y0
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate of the start circle.

params.name: r0
params.description: The radius of the start circle.

params.name: x1
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate of the end circle.

params.name: y1
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate of the end circle.

params.name: r1
params.description: The radius of the end circle.

params.name: steps
params.description: The steps.

methods.name: createEllipse
methods.description: Adds an ellipse to the path which is centered at (X, Y) position with the radius radiusX and radiusY starting atstartAngle and ending at endAngle going in the given direction by anticlockwise (defaulting to clockwise).

params.name: dx
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate for the ellipse's center.

params.name: dy
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate for the ellipse's center.

params.name: radiusX
params.description: The ellipse's major-axis radius.

params.name: radiusY
params.description: The ellipse's minor-axis radius.

params.name: rotation
params.description: The rotation for this ellipse, expressed in radians.

params.name: startAngle
params.description: The starting point, measured from the x axis, from which it will be drawn, expressedin radians.

params.name: endAngle
params.description: The end ellipse's angle to which it will be drawn, expressed in radians.

params.name: anticlockwise
params.description: An optional Boolean which, if true, draws the ellipse anticlockwise(counter-clockwise), otherwise in a clockwise direction.

methods.name: arc
methods.description: Adds an arc to the path which is centered at (X, Y) position with radius r starting at startAngle and ending atendAngle going in the given direction by anticlockwise (defaulting to clockwise).

params.name: dx
params.description: The X coordinate of the arc's center.

params.name: dy
params.description: The Y coordinate of the arc's center.

params.name: radius
params.description: The arc's radius.

params.name: startAngle
params.description: The angle at which the arc starts, measured clockwise from the positive x axis andexpressed in radians.

params.name: endAngle
params.description: The angle at which the arc ends, measured clockwise from the positive x axis andexpressed in radians.

params.name: anticlockwise
params.description: An optional Boolean which, if true, causes the arc to be drawncounter-clockwise between the two angles. By default it is drawn clockwise.

methods.name: arcTo
methods.description: Adds an arc to the path with the given control points and radius, connected to the previous point by a straight line.

params.name: x1
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate for the first control point.

params.name: y1
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate for the first control point.

params.name: x2
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate for the second control point.

params.name: y2
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate for the second control point.

params.name: radius
params.description: The arc's radius.

methods.name: quadraticCurveTo
methods.description: Adds a quadratic Bzier curve to the path. It requires two points. The first point is a control point and thesecond one is the end point. The starting point is the last point in the current path, which can be changed usingmoveTo() before creating the quadratic Bzier curve.

params.name: cpx
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate for the control point.

params.name: cpy
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate for the control point.

params.name: dx
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate for the end point.

params.name: dy
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate for the end point.

methods.name: bezierCurveTo
methods.description: Adds a cubic Bzier curve to the path. It requires three points. The first two points are control points and thethird one is the end point. The starting point is the last point in the current path, which can be changed usingmoveTo() before creating the Bzier curve.

params.name: cp1x
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate for the first control point.

params.name: cp1y
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate for first control point.

params.name: cp2x
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate for the second control point.

params.name: cp2y
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate for the second control point.

params.name: dx
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate for the end point.

params.name: dy
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate for the end point.

methods.name: lineTo
methods.description: Connects the last point in the sub-path to the x, y coordinates with a straight line

params.name: dx
params.description: The x axis of the coordinate for the end of the line.

params.name: dy
params.description: The y axis of the coordinate for the end of the line.

methods.name: moveTo
methods.description: Moves the starting point of a new sub-path to the (X, Y) coordinates.

params.name: dx
params.description: The x axis of the point.

params.name: dy
params.description: The y axis of the point.

methods.name: setShadowBlur
methods.description: Set the shadow's blur.

params.name: radius
params.description: The shadow's blur radius to set.

methods.name: setShadowColor
methods.description: Set the shadow's color.

params.name: color
params.description: A canvas' color resolvable to set as shadow's color.

methods.name: setShadowOffsetX
methods.description: Set the property that specifies the distance that the shadow will be offset in horizontal distance.

params.name: value
params.description: The value in pixels for the distance.

methods.name: setShadowOffsetY
methods.description: Set the property that specifies the distance that the shadow will be offset in vertical distance.

params.name: value
params.description: The value in pixels for the distance.

methods.name: setMiterLimit
methods.description: Sets the miter limit ratio in space units. When getting, it returns the current value (10.0 by default). Whensetting, zero, negative, Infinity and NaN values are ignored; otherwise the current value is set to the new value.

params.name: value
params.description: A number specifying the miter limit ratio in space units. Zero, negative, Infinity and NaNvalues are ignored.

methods.name: setPatternQuality
methods.description: Change the pattern quality

params.name: pattern
params.description: The pattern quality.

methods.name: setTextDrawingMode
methods.description: Set the text drawing mode. Using glyph is much faster than path for drawing, and when using a PDF context willembed the text natively, so will be selectable and lower filesize. The downside is that cairo does not have anysubpixel precision for glyph, so this will be noticeably lower quality for text positioning in cases such asrotated text. Also, strokeText in glyph will act the same as fillText, except using the stroke style for the fill.

params.name: mode
params.description: The drawing mode.

methods.name: setAntialiasing
methods.description: Set anti-aliasing mode.

params.name: antialias
params.description: The antialias mode.

methods.name: setGlobalCompositeOperation
methods.description: Sets the type of compositing operation to apply when drawing new shapes, where type is a string identifying whichof the compositing or blending mode operations to use.

params.name: type
params.description: The global composite operation mode.

methods.name: setGlobalAlpha
methods.description: Modify the alpha value that is applied to shapes and images before they are drawn into the canvas.

params.name: value
params.description: The alpha value, from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque)

methods.name: resetShadows
methods.description: Reset the canvas' shadows.

methods.name: clearCircle
methods.description: Clear a circle.

params.name: dx
params.description: The position x in the center of the clip's circle.

params.name: dy
params.description: The position y in the center of the clip's circle.

params.name: radius
params.description: The radius for the clip.

params.name: start
params.description: The degree in radians to start drawing the circle.

params.name: angle
params.description: The degree in radians to finish drawing the circle, defaults to a full circle.

methods.name: clearPixels
methods.description: Clear an area.

params.name: dx
params.description: The position x to start drawing the element.

params.name: dy
params.description: The position y to start drawing the element.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the element.

params.name: height
params.description: The heigth of the element.

returns.description: An Array. A list of numbers that specifies distances to alternately draw a line and a gap (incoordinate space units). If the number, when setting the elements, was odd, the elements of the array get copiedand concatenated. For example, setting the line dash to [5, 15, 25] will result in getting back [5, 15, 25, 5, 15,25].

methods.name: isPointInPath
methods.description: Reports whether or not the specified point is contained in the current path.

params.name: dx
params.description: The X coordinate of the point to check.

params.name: dy
params.description: The Y coordinate of the point to check.

params.name: fillRule
params.description: The algorithm by which to determine if a point is inside a path oroutside a path.

methods.name: isPointInStroke
methods.description: Reports whether or not the specified point is inside the area contained by the stroking of a path.

params.name: dx
params.description: The X coordinate of the point to check.

params.name: dy
params.description: The Y coordinate of the point to check.

methods.name: process
methods.description: Process data with this as the context

params.name: fn
params.description: A callback function

params.name: args
params.description: Extra arguments to pass to the function

methods.name: addTextFont
methods.description: Register a new font (Canvas 1.6.x).

params.name: path
params.description: The path for the font.

params.name: family
params.description: The font's family name.

methods.name: toBuffer
methods.description: Render the canvas into a buffer.

params.name: args
params.description: The render's options.

methods.name: toBufferAsync
methods.description: Render the canvas into a buffer using a Promise.

methods.name: toDataURL
methods.description: Render the canvas into a Data URL.

params.name: type
params.description: the standard MIME type for the image format to return. If you do not specify this parameter, the default value is PNG.

params.name: args
params.description: Extra arguments

methods.name: toDataURLAsync
methods.description: Render the canvas into a Data URL using a Promise.

params.name: type
params.description: the standard MIME type for the image format to return. If you do not specify this parameter, the default value is PNG.

methods.name: _resolveImage
methods.description: Resolves an Image or Buffer

params.name: imageOrBuffer
params.description: An Image instance or a buffer

params.name: cb
params.description: The callback

methods.name: fromCanvas
methods.description: Create a canvas from an HTMLCanvasElement or NodeCanvas instance
examples: // Node.jsconst canvasInstance = Canvas.createCanvas(200, 200);const buffer = CanvasConstructor.fromCanvas(canvasElement)    .setColor('green')    .addRect(10, 10, 100, 100)    .toBuffer();

params.name: canvas
params.description: The canvas element

methods.name: registerFont
methods.description: <warning>registerFont is not supported in node-canvas 1.6.x, you will need to use node-canvas 2.x</warning>Register a new font (Canvas 2.x).

params.name: path
params.description: The path for the font.

params.name: family
params.description: The font's family name.
